intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. glaphyranthus, commonly known as the golden buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features showy, bright yellow flowers with a distinctive, broad, shield-shaped petal that resembles a crown. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. Its flowers bloom in spring, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows, wetlands, and along stream banks.
